QuestionText: Who is the ancient Greek philosopher that taught that 'know thyself' was the most important maxim?
What is the term for the philosophical idea that reality is fundamentally made up of mind or spirit?
Which of the following philosophers wrote 'Thus Spoke Zarathustra'?
What is the name of the philosophical concept that argues that certain knowledge is impossible?
Who is the philosopher that argued that humans are inherently selfish and that morality is based on self-interest?
What is the term for the philosophical idea that reality is made up of both mind and matter?
Which of the following philosophers is known for his concept of the 'social contract'?
What is the name of the philosophical concept that argues that truth is relative to individual perspectives?
Who is the ancient Greek philosopher that taught that the goal of human life is to achieve happiness and fulfillment through living a virtuous life?
What is the term for the philosophical idea that reality is fundamentally made up of physical matter?
